thread.section_title: Science News and Analysis - Wall Street Journal
thread.title: Here’s a Change: U.S. Borrowing Costs Among Highest in Developed World

author: Richard Barley
title: Here’s a Change: U.S. Borrowing Costs Among Highest in Developed World
text:
As if there weren’t enough evidence that the ground is shifting in markets, here’s something that hasn’t happened in nearly two decades: America is paying more to borrow than Australia.
For the first time since 2000, U.S. 10-year yields, at 2.88%, are above those of Australia, at 2.84%, notes ADMISI, a brokerage unit of agricultural giant Archer Daniels Midland. At first glance, this makes sense. Benchmark yields have converged as the U.S. Federal Reserve has raised rates while the Reserve Bank of Australia has stood pat....
